content: 11 sts/13 rounds = 4 inches/10 cm in assigned pooling pattern stitch note gauge is always taken after blocking pattern notes foundation half_double_crochet set up start with a slip knot on your hook chain 3 yo insert hook into the first chain by the slip knot yo & draw a loop through yo draw through one loop yo draw through 3 loops chain 3 counts as first stitch 2 stitches total set up complete repeatable sequence yo insert your hook into the base of the previous stitch yo & draw a loop through yo draw through one loop yo draw through 3 loops one stitch complete half_double_crochet begin with a yo on hook insert hook yo & draw a loop through 3 loops on hook yo and draw through 3 loops on hook one stitch complete double_crochet bobble puff worked over 2 stitches at the contrast color change make the first bobble puff begin with a yo insert hook into the next stitch yo & draw a loop through yo draw through 2 loops 2 loops on hook yo insert hook into the same space yo & draw a loop through yo draw through 2 loops 3 loops on hook yo insert hook into the same space yo & draw a loop through yo draw through 2 loops 4 loops on hook yo draw through 4 loops make the second bobble puff begin with a yo insert hook into the next stitch yo & draw a loop through yo draw through 2 loops 2 loops on hook yo insert hook into the same space yo & draw a loop through yo draw through 2 loops 3 loops on hook yo insert hook into the same space yo & draw a loop through yo draw through 2 loops 4 loops on hook yo draw through 4 loops the bobble puff stitches will be affected by the contrast color length your hook size gauge and gauge adjust accordingly you may need a larger bobble puff more yarn overs or a smaller bobble puff less yarn overs pattern cowl set up for the set-up ignore the color changes make 88 176 foundation half_double_crochet be careful not to twist and join in the round slip_stitch the last stitch with the top of the chain 3 work the first stitch of the next round in the same space round 2 and all remaining rounds work in spiral rounds in the assigned pooling stitch pattern with main color half_double_crochet into each stitch at the contrast color make a bobble puff across 2 stitches return to the main color and hald double_crochet around 88 176 stitches when your work is the desired length or you have a small amount of yarn remaining work the last hald double_crochet to achieve a smooth edge single crochet across the next 3 stitches and slip_stitch across the next 3 stitches leave enough yarn to weave the end cut your yarn and draw the tail through the last stitch to fasten_off finishing
